result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy J. Mayotte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(4).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Taylor County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall submit to a DNA sample at the Taylor County Sheriff's Department.  The costs are to be added to defendant's current payment plan.  Defendant is to pay $100.00 a month beginning January 30, 2017.

Defendant is given a furlough.  The jail sentence shall begin no later than December 15, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  The jail sentence shall be served with huber and good time.  
The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.  

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeremy J. Mayotte in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Defendant Jeremy J. Mayotte in custody.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into the record.  Victim rights complied with. Victim is in court.  Plea of no contest to Count 2 and 5. Plea colloquy.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court dismisses and read in counts 1, 3, 4 & 6.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 2 and 5.  Court indicated that there is 319 days of sentence credit.  Statement by Attorney Tlusty.  Statement by victim.  Statement by Attorney Cveykus.  Attorney Cveykus is requesting that defendant be granted a furlough.   Court orders on count 2 one year county jail with huber and good time; court costs; DNA sample and surcharge.  Count 5 court orders six months county jail with huber and good time; court costs.  Court grants furlough of 45 days from today.  Defendant to begin jail sentence on December 15, 2016 at 4:30 pm.  Court orders that these obligations be added to his current payment plan but payment are increased to $100.00 a month with the first payment due January 30, 2016.

of court proceeding
Taylor Co. Arrest Report

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $10,000.00 cash bond with conditions of: No Contact with T.R.R. dob: 4-26-72; No possession or consumption of alcohol; begin bond revocation on 15CM36 and 15CM35.  Court ordered bond with conditions as requested.  Court directs clerk to begin bond revocation on 15CM36 and 15CM35.  Initial appearance set for January 12, 2015 at 1:00 p.m. - ba
